column5: I'm sitting in my cabin at Sportsman's Lodge, overlooking Little Vermilion Lake, just a short flight north of Red Lake, Ontario. Two of us arrived Friday afternoon after a 1500 mile drive from Tennessee. Pike fishing has been good and our weather has been better than decent since we arrived. We're going to have hot, sunny days for about a week.Most in camp are fishing with dead bait, but our pike are eating Johnson Silver Minnows and Suicks for us. We're only hitting the water from 10:30 a.m. to around 6:30 p.m. We'll be joined by the rest of our party for the walleye opener and a second week for my partner and me. Then we'll be staying out for the evening walleye bite and having walleye dinners at 11 p.m. Lots of sleep for us this week and not so much during our second week.We're expecting to find huge pike in shallow water this afternoon after the sun warms shallow bays.So far we've boated plenty of pike with none under 35", but only a few over 40". Most have come from moving water. Bigger pike should be waiting for us in shallow water beginning today or tomorrow for sure. We'll give them a chance.Life if good up here. Warmer here than in Tennessee today.
Have a good time Connie. We're headed north Thursday morning
You're living the life Connie! Have a great trip and stay safe.

Hey Connie, you went right past Bug River and didn't stop to say hi?I've been at the boat launch by the bridge for 3 hours the other day , got 2 that were over 36" , 1 over 38" and one about 30" sitting in my lawn chair smoking a cigar, what a way to spend a couple hours.Have fun at Little V .

I fully intended to stop by and visit with you, Kim and Wendy, but on Wednesday our flying time was moved from Saturday morning to Friday at 3 p.m. We were squeezed to make it. My loss.Great weather for sure. Just like last May 15 week.
Amen to that Solo I'll try to keep him awake next week
Somehow I doubt that'll be a problem Phil.You guys have a great time!
